item.title: Unit testing with python
item.description: There is no denying that unit testing is dropping our team’s bug counter to nearly zero, as opposed to the mess it once was. I won’t be advocating for TDD or trying to convince you that this is the only thing you can do to ensure quality software. It’s not the only thing we did, and it’s certainly not the most important one. But, if you are looking to apply unit tests to your python program, this is sort of a guide to what I think are the most important things you should know.
